result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Oral arguments on November 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Letter from Lindsey Peterson requesting bond modification
09-20-2022 - Per Judge Melvin:  No action, not a motion, he is represented.  kms
Request for Adjournment
Defendant's reply to State's response : Motion to sever
DEFENDANTS REPLY TO STATES RESPONSE REGARDING RAPE SHIELD EVIDENCE
State's Response to Motion for Severance
State's Response to Motion to Admit Rape Shield Evidence

**AMENDED 07-18-2022** - Property Bond may be posted in lieu of $500,000 cash.  
Defendant may not leave the State of Wisconsin.  No contact with any victims listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant must be on GPS monitoring with WCS.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.
Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) or witness(es) listed in the Criminal Complaint and identified in the Victim Identification Key and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  Defendant will not disclose the identification of the victims in any way except for purposes of court proceedings or investigation. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Oral arguments on September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

District Attorney Sue Opper appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jessa Nicholson appears on behalf of Gerardo Baca who appears in person, in custody.  Victim/Witness Representative appears with Victims A, B, and E via Zoom.  
Attorney Nicholson made statements to the Court regarding bail motion and advises the Court that she has the defendant's passport 
which they can surrender if needed.  Defense counsel advised parties of conversation with Corporation Counsel regarding property bond.  State asks for clarification regarding value of property and cash bond.  State objects to motion.  Defense gives response.  Court will allow property to be posted in lieu of cash but denies reduction of cash bail.  Bond restrictions are as follows: Defendant may not leave the State of Wisconsin, no contact with any victims listed in the Criminal Complaint and defendant must be on GPS monitoring with WCS.  All other conditions remain as stated. Parties made discussion regarding Severance Motion and scheduling.  State's brief is due 8/19/22; Defense response is due 9/9/22.  Matter set for Arguments on Friday, 9/23 at 1:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Admit Evidence Regarding Complaining Witness' Priors Sexual Relationship with Defendant
Defendant's Motion for Relief from Prejudicial Joinder
VW Zoom Victim Request
Bail/bond hearing on July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Kristi J. Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gerardo Baca in court, in custody, with Attorney Jessa K. Nicholson who appeared by zoom video.  Victim Witness Specialist appeared by zoom with Victims A, E, and F.  Attorney Nicholson states she has received discovery and is still in the process of listening to audio and needs to view the video discovery.  Attorney Nicholson anticipates a motion to sever and additional pre-trial motions to be filed and requests a scheduling order as to when motions are due.  State indicates they have turned over six discs and 79 pages of discovery acknowledging there is a large amount of digital discovery in this matter.  The Court will not yet set a briefing schedule until motions are filed and will set a status date for further scheduling.  The Court orders any motion be filed by July 15, 2022, and will set a status date the next week to set further dates and briefing schedules.  The Court sets a status hearing for July 18, 2022, at 2:30 p.m., and informs the victims they may appear by zoom for the next date.

Per Judge Melvin, the victims/witnesses are allowed to appear by Zoom for the hearing on 5/20 at 8:30 am.  kms

records.addlTxt:
04-08-2022 AMENDMENT:  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.
Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) or witness(es) listed in the Criminal Complaint and identified in the Victim Identification Key and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  Defendant will not disclose the identification of the victims in any way except for purposes of court proceedings or investigation. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Gerardo Baca in court, in custody, with Attorney Jessa Nicholson.  Attorney Susan Opper and Attorney Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholson previously filed a motion to dismiss.  Attorney Nicholson makes arguments in support of her motion and is requesting the Court dismiss Counts 6 & 8.  Attorney Gordon makes arguments in support of the State's objection to the motion.  Attorney Nicholson further argues her motion.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court will deny the motion to dismiss Counts 6 & 8.  Waukesha County Sheriff's Department Detective Aaron Hoppe sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Opper.  Cross examination by Attorney Nicholson.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Nicholson objects to bind over without argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Timely filed is a motion for substitution of Judge Bohren.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Once the case has been reassigned the parties will receive notice of the next date.  The Court addresses the victims in Zoom to see if any would like to be heard.  Victim Witness Representative indicates none of the victims wish to be heard.  The Court will modify the conditions of bail to include "If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes."

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
VW Zoom Victim Request - PRELIM - 04-08-22
** Reviewed by Commissioner Costello on 03/24/2022: Approved **

2:06 PM  Clerk:  Jessica C. (Waukesha Co.)  Defendant, Gerardo Baca, in custody, with Attorney Jessa Nicholson Goetz by Zoom (video).  Attorneys Susan L. Opper and Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim/witness specialist and Victims A, B, E and F appeared by Zoom (video).  
Court addresses motion to modify bail. 
Attorney Goetz requests the cash bail be lowered to $70,000.00 or defendant's family be allowed to post property bonds in the amount of $200,000.00.  
Attorney Opper objects to any bail modification and requests Corporation Counsel be allowed to investigate the issue of property bonds if the Court is considering that option.
Rebuttal by Attorney Goetz.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court denies the motion to modify bond as to the amount of the bond and as to the property bonds.
This matter is currently set for preliminary hearing on 4/8/22 at 9:15 am in front of the Court Commissioner.
Court addresses the Motion to Dismiss.  Both parties agree that this motion could be heard by the Court Commissioner immediately prior to the Preliminary Hearing.
Court orders the Court Commissioner to hear the Motion to Dismiss at the Preliminary Hearing prior to conducting the Preliminary Hearing on 4/8/22 at 9:15 am.

Request to Appear via zoom
** Reviewed by Judge Bohren on 03/23/2022 : Request approved.**

Media Order

Bail/bond hearing on March 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

VW Zoom Victim Request - PRELIM - 04-08-22
** Reviewed by Commissioner Costello on 03/14/2022: Request granted.  **
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Motion for Modification of Cash Bail and Brief in Support of Motion for Modification of Cash Bail
Original Warrant/served warrant filed with the court.

1:53 p.m.  Court in session.  Prosecuting Attorney Susan L. Opper appeared by video (Zoom) for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nathan Tierney Otis appeared by video (Zoom) on behalf of Attorney Jessica Nicholson for Gerardo Baca. Defendant Gerardo Baca appeared by video (Zoom), in custody.  
Attorney Otis acknowledges receipt of the Criminal Complaint and waives its reading.  
Bond argument by DA Opper.  Bond argument by Attorney Otis.  No victim comments regarding bond.  
Court sets a $500,000 cash bond, no contact with any victim(s) or witness(es) listed in the Criminal Complaint and Victim Identification Key, no third party contact, Defendant not to disclose identification of victims in any way except for purposes of court proceedings or investigation.  
Preliminary Hearing requested by Attorney Otis, time limits waived.  Waukesha County Judge Bohren has been specifically assigned to this case as of today.  Preliminary Hearing date to be scheduled.  
DA Susan Opper withdraws the State's motion to seal Criminal Complaint and Arrest Warrant, no objection by Attorney Otis, no victim comments.  Court orders Criminal Complaint and Arrest Warrant unsealed.
2:15 p.m.  Court in recess.
